title: How to Create an "About Me" Book

steps.headline: To make the book, you'll need a scrapbook or Duo-Tang or notebook.
steps.description: Something to put all your stuff in. Find something that suits your needs. Scrapbooks are expensive though, so maybe a notebook or duo-tang is more in your price range.

steps.headline: Decorate the cover.
steps.description: Put your name and use stickers and photos and felts - whatever you like. You can even use letters & pictures from magazines!

steps.headline: Make the first page about who you are.
steps.description: Example: name, address, second name, phone number, birthday, people born on your birthday, mother and father, siblings, favorite teacher  etc.

steps.headline: Other pages can be friends, pets, family tree, favorites, if I had a million dollars, dreams, future, destiny etc.
Have an autograph page in the back!
steps.description: This way, friends & family can write sweet and funny messages for you to enjoy!

steps.headline: Look at your About Me book whenever you need a pick me up or just want to look at some pictures!
Put in amusing quotes throughout the scrapbook.
steps.description: Have it describe your personality, your life, or just a funny quote you enjoy. If you and your friend(s) say lots of random/funny things, include a page just for quotes; it'll be well worth remembering them down the track! Write each person's quote in their favorite color, maybe in a fancy font.

steps.headline: Add sections or pages for things that you and your friends like.
steps.description: If you like a band, make a place for that band. If you like a book, make a place for that book.

steps.headline: Write and include the lyrics of your favorite song.
steps.description: Add a picture of the person that sings it, if you'd like.

steps.headline: Write a poem and mount it in a decorative frame in the scrapbook.
Don't forget to write what is important to you and what makes you special.

text: To make the book, you'll need a scrapbook or Duo-Tang or notebook. Something to put all your stuff in. Find something that suits your needs. Scrapbooks are expensive though, so maybe a notebook or duo-tang is more in your price range. Decorate the cover. Put your name and use stickers and photos and felts - whatever you like. You can even use letters & pictures from magazines! Make the first page about who you are. Example: name, address, second name, phone number, birthday, people born on your birthday, mother and father, siblings, favorite teacher  etc. Other pages can be friends, pets, family tree, favorites, if I had a million dollars, dreams, future, destiny etc.  Have an autograph page in the back! This way, friends & family can write sweet and funny messages for you to enjoy! Look at your About Me book whenever you need a pick me up or just want to look at some pictures! Use it like a scrapbook! Put in amusing quotes throughout the scrapbook. Have it describe your personality, your life, or just a funny quote you enjoy. If you and your friend(s) say lots of random/funny things, include a page just for quotes; it'll be well worth remembering them down the track! Write each person's quote in their favorite color, maybe in a fancy font. Add sections or pages for things that you and your friends like. If you like a band, make a place for that band. If you like a book, make a place for that book. Write and include the lyrics of your favorite song. Add a picture of the person that sings it, if you'd like. Write a poem and mount it in a decorative frame in the scrapbook.  Don't forget to write what is important to you and what makes you special.
